methods.name: size()
methods.description: Returns number of nodes in SinglyLinkedList instance.

methods.name: sizeRecursive(node = this.head)
methods.description: Returns number of nodes in SinglyLinkedList instance(recursively).

methods.name: clear()
methods.description: Clears SinglyLinkedList instance.

methods.name: print()
methods.description: Prints each node in SinglyLinkedList instance to console.

methods.name: getLast()
methods.description: Returns last node in SinglyLinkedList instance.

methods.name: push(data)
methods.description: Creates new node with data parameter and adds to beginning to SinglyLinkedList.

methods.name: append(data)
methods.description: Creates new node with data parameter and adds to end of SinglyLinkedList.

methods.name: insertAfter(prevNode, data)
methods.description: Creates new node with data parameter and inserts after prevNode parameter.

methods.name: deleteNodeWithMatchingKey(key)
methods.description: Given a 'key', delete the first occurrence of this key in the SinglyLinkedList.

methods.name: deleteNodeAtPosition(position)
methods.description: Deletes node at zero-indexed position in SinglyLinkedList instance.

methods.name: search(key)
methods.description: Checks whether the a node with matching key is present in SinglyLinkedList instance.

methods.name: getNth(index)
methods.description: Returns data of node at index 'n'.

methods.name: getNthRecursive(node = this.head, index)
methods.description: Returns data of node at index 'n'(recursively).

methods.name: reverse()
methods.description: Reverse order of nodes in SinglyLinkedList instance.

methods.name: reverseEveryKNodes(k, headNode)
methods.description: Reverse SinglyLinkedList instance in groups of given size.

methods.name: createNNodes(n, isRandom = false)
methods.description: Creates new SinglyLinkedList with n-number of nodes with values ranging from 0-(n-1).

staticMethods.name: mergeTwoSortedLists(firstHeadNode, secondHeadNode)
staticMethods.description: Merges two sorted SinglyLinkedList instances to one sorted list.

staticMethods.name: getMiddle(headNode)
staticMethods.description: Utility function to get middle of the linked list.

methods.name: push(item)
methods.description: Adds an item in the stack. If the stack is full, then it is said to be an Overflow condition.

methods.name: pop()
methods.description: Removes an item from the stack. The items are popped in the reversed order in which they are pushed. If the stack is empty, then it is said to be an Underflow condition.

methods.name: peek()
methods.description: Returns top element of stack.

methods.name: print()
methods.description: Print each element of stack (top-to-bottom) to console.

methods.name: insertAtBottom(item)
methods.description: Recursive function that inserts an element at bottom of the stack.

methods.name: reverse()
methods.description: Reverse the linked list instance using recursive insertAtBottom()

methods.name: sort(toAscending = true)
methods.description: Sorts stack with values in ascending/descending order.

staticMethods.name: sortedInsert(stack, element)
staticMethods.description: Insert element into stack in ascending sorted way.

staticMethods.name: sortedInsertDescending(stack, element)
staticMethods.description: Insert element into stack in descending sorted way.

methodsThatUseDataStructure.name: infixToPostfix(infixStr)
methodsThatUseDataStructure.description: Convert infix expression to postfix expression.

methodsThatUseDataStructure.name: areBracketsBalanced(bracketStr)
methodsThatUseDataStructure.description: Tests whether brackets in expression are balanced.

methodsThatUseDataStructure.name: printNGE(arr, size = arr.length)
methodsThatUseDataStructure.description: Prints the element and Next Greater Element (NGE) pair for all elements of array.

methods.name: push(item)
methods.description: Adds an item in the stack. If the stack is full, then it is said to be an Overflow condition.

methods.name: pop()
methods.description: Removes an item from the stack. The items are popped in the reversed order in which they are pushed. If the stack is empty, then it is said to be an Underflow condition.

methods.name: peek()
methods.description: Returns top element of stack.

methods.name: print()
methods.description: Print each element of stack (top-to-bottom) to console.

methods.name: insertAtBottom(item)
methods.description: Recursive function that inserts an element at bottom of the stack.

methods.name: reverse()
methods.description: Reverse the linked list instance using recursive insertAtBottom()

methods.name: sort(toAscending = true)
methods.description: Sorts stack with values in ascending/descending order.

staticMethods.name: sortedInsert(stack, element)
staticMethods.description: Insert element into stack in ascending sorted way.

staticMethods.name: sortedInsertDescending(stack, element)
staticMethods.description: Insert element into stack in descending sorted way.

methodsThatUseDataStructure.name: reverseString(str)
methodsThatUseDataStructure.description: Reverse string using stack data structure.

methods.name: push1(item)
methods.description: Adds an item in the front stack. If the stack is full, then it is said to be an Overflow condition.

methods.name: push2(item)
methods.description: Adds an item in the back stack. If the stack is full, then it is said to be an Overflow condition.

methods.name: pop1()
methods.description: Removes an item from the front stack. The items are popped in the reversed order in which they are pushed. If the stack is empty, then it is said to be an Underflow condition.

methods.name: pop2()
methods.description: Removes an item from the back stack. The items are popped in the reversed order in which they are pushed. If the stack is empty, then it is said to be an Underflow condition.
